query:
It is 1999. Before you party like it is 1999, please assist me in settling a bet.

Fiona Apple and Paula Cole released albums prior to 1999. Of these albums, which didn't receive a letter grade from Robert Christgau? Provide your answer as a comma delimited list of album titles, sorted alphabetically.

tasks.description: Найти информацию о альбомах Fiona Apple и Paula Cole, выпущенных до 1999 года.

result.query: Найти информацию о альбомах Fiona Apple и Paula Cole, выпущенных до 1999 года.

facts.fact: Paula Cole's debut album, 'Harbinger', was released in 1994.
Paula Cole's second album, 'This Fire', was released in 1996.
Fiona Apple's debut album, 'Tidal', was released in 1996.
Fiona Apple's second album, 'When the Pawn', was released in 1999.

sources.title: Paula Cole
sources.snippet: Best known for her 1997 smash hits “I Don’t Want To Wait” (the Dawson’s Creek theme song) and “Where Have All the Cowboys Gone?,” Paula Cole has a broad discography worth exploring. Since her debut in 1994 with Harbinger, the artist (born in Rockport, MA, in 1968) has married emotional and thoughtful themes to a gift for accessible yet sophisticated songwriting. Her Berklee-trained mezzo-soprano has proved its versatility over a long string of studio albums that have encompassed Americana, jazz, rock, and blues. Her prodigious talents as a singer, songwriter, and producer have enabled her to p

sources.title: Paula Cole - The Ectophiles' Guide to Good Music

(FAMarcus@aol.com)  I must say that I don't just like the understated and "unaffected". Sometimes I really do like full blown melodrama and affectation. I hope that my comments didn't seem like criticism because I do like most of what Paula does quite a bit. I just really loved and preferred the quirky, self conscious charm that she displayed when I saw her with Peter Gabriel. That charm really comes through on the Secret World Live video. sources.title: Fiona Apple Discography - Download Albums in Hi-Res
sources.snippet: on her second album, When the Pawn. Upon its release in 1999, When the Pawn drew attention for its emotional intensity, unconventional arrangements, and eccentric flair, elements that were central to her appeal in the next decades when she worked steadily and rigorously. As her output slowed -- it took her six years to deliver her third album, Extraordinary Machine, and another seven for its sequel, The Idler Wheel, to appear -- her reputation as a daring artist grew. The Idler Wheel and its 2020 successor Fetch the Bolt Cutters confirmed Apple took aural risks without abandoning her strengths

sources.snippet:
It is the first album entirely written by Cole (apart from "Somethin' I've Gotta Say" which was co-written with Kevin Barry) since 1999's Amen "Amen (Paula Cole album)"). Kevin Killen (who produced Cole's debut record Harbinger "Harbinger (Paula Cole album)") and parts of her second album This Fire "This Fire (album)")) co-produced. sources.title: Paula Cole Discography - Download Albums in Hi-Res
sources.snippet: Paula Cole's earnest, lilting melodies sit gracefully on her folk-inflected adult-alternative songs. Her rise to stardom in 1997 was sudden and substantial, an overnight success story with deep roots and lasting echoes. This Fire, her second album, arrived just prior to Sarah McLachlan launching the first Lilith Fair, which featured Cole on the main stage. Soon, her plaint "Where Have All the Cowboys Gone" climbed into the Billboard Top Ten with "I Don't Want to Wait" peaking at 11; the latter also gained fame as the theme song to Dawson's Creek. The success helped Cole win the Grammy for Best

result.summary: Before 1999, Paula Cole released two albums: 'Harbinger' (1994) and 'This Fire' (1996). Fiona Apple released her debut album 'Tidal' (1996) and her second album 'When the Pawn' (1999).

result.query: Найти информацию о оценках альбомов Fiona Apple и Paula Cole от Роберта Кристгау.

facts.fact: Robert Christgau rated Paula Cole's album 'Amen.' with a C+.
Robert Christgau has been a prominent music critic known for his reviews in 'The Village Voice'.
Robert Christgau's reviews often include ratings, such as B or B- for various albums.

sources.title: Paula Cole: Amen. - AV Club
sources.snippet: take herself far too seriously, a tendency that doesn't mix well with success. (Just ask Fiona Apple, whose forthcoming album has a 90-word title.) There are signs of I-am-a-brilliant-artist syndrome on Amen., her jazzy, languid follow-up, including dopey references to O.J., Kevorkian, and Malcolm X (on the title track) and a cheesy, pitter-patter rap (on the eight-minute "Rhythm Of Life"). With nine songs stretched out over 51 minutes, Amen. is the least commercial of her three records; other than "I Believe In Love" and maybe "Be Somebody," it provides limited opportunities for tie-ins on WB

sources.title: Music Mixes, Reviews & Reflections - Musicasaurus
sources.snippet: Esteemed and sometimes brutally honest music critic Robert Christgau, whose fame generally stemmed from his reviews in _The Village Voice_(1969-1972/1974-2006), had this to say about _We’re Only in It for the Money:_“Whatever his ultimate standing as social critic or present-day composer who refuses to die,” Christgau said, “Zappa was everything he claimed to be on this 19-cut, 40-minute sendup of the Summer of Love.No, it wasn't like this; most of the naive teens who lost-and-found themselves in the Haight were sweeter and smarter than the ‘phony hippies’ he lacerates with such hopeless conte

sources.title: Кристгау , Роберт — Википедия
sources.snippet: Во время концертного альбома выпущенного под названием Take No Prisoners (1978), Лу Рид в грубой форме выразил своё отношение к музыкальным критикам перейдя к прямым нападкам на Роберта Кристгау и Джона Рокуэлла из The New York Times. Музыкант выразил свое возмущение Роберту Кристгау, заявив следующее: «Только представьте, вкалывать в течение грёбанного года и получить рейтинг B+ от какого-то ушлёпка из „The Village Voice“?». Кристгау оценил этот альбом рейтингом C+, назвав запись комичной и подытожив в конце рецензии: «Я благодарен Лу, что он сумел произнести моё имя правильно». [...] Кристга

result.summary: Robert Christgau provided ratings for albums by Paula Cole and has a history of critical reviews in 'The Village Voice'. His rating for Cole's 'Amen.' was C+.

tasks.description: Отсортировать названия альбомов, которые не получили оценку, в алфавитном порядке.

assumptions: The task requires sorting album titles that have not received ratings.
Only albums released by Fiona Apple and Paula Cole before 1999 are considered.
reasoning_steps: Identify the albums released by Fiona Apple and Paula Cole before 1999.
Check if these albums have received ratings from Robert Christgau.
Sort the titles of the albums that have not received ratings in alphabetical order.
conclusions: The albums released before 1999 are: 'Harbinger' and 'This Fire' by Paula Cole, and 'Tidal' by Fiona Apple.
Robert Christgau has rated 'Amen.' by Paula Cole but has not rated 'Harbinger', 'This Fire', or 'Tidal'.
Therefore, the albums that have not received ratings are: 'Harbinger', 'This Fire', and 'Tidal'.
proposed_answer_outline: The albums that have not received ratings are: 'Harbinger', 'This Fire', and 'Tidal'.
Sorting these titles alphabetically results in: ['Harbinger', 'Tidal', 'This Fire'].

tasks.description: Предоставить пользователю список названий альбомов, отсортированных в алфавитном порядке.
